str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Perhaps from a and the base of meros; properly, to miss the mark, i.e. to err, especially to sin.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From husteros; to be later, i.e. to be inferior; generally, to fall short.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
